dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Vidthayanon, C. 2012. Brachygobius doriae. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: The species is known from coastal southeast Asia, from the Mae Khlong in Thailand to the Mekong basin (Cambodia, Lao PDR, and Viet Nam), Malaysia (Peninsular and Sarawak), Singapore, Indonesia (Kalimantan) and Brunei.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution

Red List Criteria

Version

Year Assessed
2012

Assessor/s
Vidthayanon, C.

Reviewer/s
Allen, D. & Smith, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
This common goby is widespread throughout coastal Southeast Asia, it nave no significant threat recently, and to be assessed as Least Concern.
